title: A little bit about me!
text:
What I Do
Hello, nice to meet you! I’m Janelle, currently a year 2 Psychology major with a minor in CNM!
For my own notice:
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: The Americas: The Alcohol scene
text:
A paradox in liquid form.
It exists as a symbol of youth and jubilance to some, inscribed and emboldened into the tapestry of regional cultures, from the lively carnivals in Brazil to the spirited fiestas in Mexico.
Yet, omens of death and tragedy dance amongst the shadows of these celebrations. It has been notorious for plaguing lives with addiction, causing countless accidents, and thickening the web of societal issues.
With such a seemingly complex and dichotomous picture, one question arises:

title: How this website came about!
text:
I thought it’d be interesting to be able to pick up some coding skills, so here I am in NM2207! Though it’s proving to be rather painful, I’ve come to enjoy seeing unintelligible lines of code manifest in the form of exciting visuals.
My initial decision to enroll in this module stemmed from my interest in UX/UI design. I was itching to know what goes on behind the scenes of every website, and I really wanted to be able to create a website I could call my own.
In essence, as tacky as it sounds, I just wanted a taste of what it’s like as a stem-girly.
Final thoughts:
It tastes so frustratingly bitter-sweet, but sweet nonetheless.
Access my Github below!

title: The Americas: The Alcohol scene
section: What exactly is the extent of substance abuse and its public health consequences in the Americas?
text:
What exactly is the extent of substance abuse and its public health consequences in the Americas?
Hence, to further understand the alcohol scene, we must turn to the data, which paints a vivid portrait of alcohol’s pervasive presence and its impacts in the region of the Americas.

Alcohol consumption in the Americas is one of the highest in the world.
According to Ritchie and Roser (2018) the global average consumption was 6.17 liters per person in 2018.
As can be seen from the figure below when looking at all types of beverages, a good portion of the countries in the Americas were above the global average.






With these statistics, it is easier to see what the alcohol scene is like within the specific countries in the region.


Naturally, such high alcohol consumption levels come with its consequences.
To delve into the rather pervasive impacts of alcohol, we turn our attention to data sets that highlight the regional dependence on alcohol, along with its morbid companion, liver cirrhosis.
